response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18 years old)", "high", "Young age is associated with higher risk for recidivism due to greater impulsivity and ongoing development."],
    ["Race (Black)", "medium", "While race itself is not a causal factor, systemic factors and disparities can influence outcomes."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "high", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate a criminal history that elevates recidivism risk."],
    ["Education (No high school diploma/GED)", "high", "Lack of education is strongly correlated with reduced opportunities and higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (Held 2 jobs in the year)", "medium", "Some employment may provide stability, but limited job history suggests economic instability."],
    ["Substance Use (Recent marijuana use)", "medium", "Drug use, even if marijuana, can be associated with behavioral issues and higher risk."],
    ["Mental Health (Episodes of feeling down)", "medium", "Depressive symptoms may impair judgment and coping skills, contributing to risk."],
    ["Living Situation (Living alone, never married)", "medium", "Limited social support and isolation can increase vulnerability to recidivism."],
    ["Family/Environment (Urban upbringing with biological mother in a household of 4)", "medium", "Urban environments may present higher exposure to criminogenic influences."],
    ["Religious Belief (Attributing events to God's will)", "low", "A belief in a higher purpose can sometimes serve as a protective factor through community and support."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher risk for recidivism due to greater impulsivity and ongoing development.
While race itself is not a causal factor, systemic factors and disparities can influence outcomes.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate a criminal history that elevates recidivism risk.
Lack of education is strongly correlated with reduced opportunities and higher recidivism risk.
Some employment may provide stability, but limited job history suggests economic instability.
Drug use, even if marijuana, can be associated with behavioral issues and higher risk.
Depressive symptoms may impair judgment and coping skills, contributing to risk.
Limited social support and isolation can increase vulnerability to recidivism.
Family/Environment (Urban upbringing with biological mother in a household of 4)
Urban environments may present higher exposure to criminogenic influences.
Religious Belief (Attributing events to God's will)
A belief in a higher purpose can sometimes serve as a protective factor through community and support.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
